messages: cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:31): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: type=color is supported by opera too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:33): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: whoa. Thanks. (I should always test everything *again* instead of relying on my previous testing.)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:33): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i think <link sizes> is not supported anywhere
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:33): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: Apple's documentation suggests rel="apple-touch-icon" sizes="..." is supported
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:34): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: though apple-touch-icon is currently unregistered
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:34): oh, didn't know that
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:35): <blockquote cite>? ;)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:35): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: hah. that's a good one.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:35): <ol reversed>
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:36): <a ping>? what's the status on that?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:36): Mozilla has a broken, preffed off implementation since Fx3, I think that's it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:36): IIRC, <a ping> is disabled in Firefox
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:36): does Chrome support <a ping>?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:37): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: what's broken about the Firefox impl (apart from being preffed off)?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:37): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: fwiw <meter> is supported in opera
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:37): The spec changed under us
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:38): crossorigin on img, video, audio
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:38): what's the status on <iframe srcdoc sandbox seamless>?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:39): <video mediagroup>
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:39): (also on audio)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:39): (ping is also on area)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:40): <input dirname> <textarea dirname>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:41): what's dirname?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (15:41): should start reviewing the patch for <meter>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:41): I have a vague recollection of Chrome having one or two of the new iframe attributes
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (15:41): not that really understand the reason for progress *and* meter
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:41): contextmenu=""
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:42): dropzone=""?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:42): itemscope
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: it's a new bidi thing
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:43): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: I think I'm not going to warn on microdata, since it's not particularly dangerous to use it ahead of browser impls
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:44): that's fair enough
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:44): I didn't add warning for stuff like <footer> for that reason
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:44): <footer> is also implemented these days
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:44): though using <section><h1> might be a bit dangerous, but that ship has sailed so it's not worthwhile to warn about it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:45): I'm not familiar with the threat scenarios with premature use of dropzone
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:49): maybe it's not so much of a treat, but would still be helpful to know why it doesn't work
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:05): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: progress is for progress bars. meter is for things like disk space usage indicators
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:05): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf: different widgets e.g. on Mac
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (16:05): oh, there is a different widget on some system
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (16:06): has given up with mac
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:08): it seems that Chrome doesn't support <iframe srcdoc> or <iframe seamless>
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:08): <iframe sandbox> can't be verified visually
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:09): oh. I guess I should add validation of the text/html-sandboxed MIME type, too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:10): http://blog.chromium.org/2010/05/security-in-depth-html5s-sandbox.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:10): looks like they have support
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:18): oh. nice. Opera Mini has a hidden pref for turning off phone number linkification
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:18): (that almost always ends up linkifying something that isn't a phone number)
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (16:21): chrome/linux seems to have different rendering for meter and progress, Opera/linux has the same
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:35): it's sad that CSP uses an X- header
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:36): did Chrome implement CSP with the X- syntax?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:36): that is, is CSP now more than a product-specific thing_
